From PFR


---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->
I'm not greatly happy with the names nor generality.

### PR summary [82422a9f27](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21071/commits/82422a9f27a0b07684c266e423664eca28dfe7dc)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.LinearAlgebra.FreeModule.ModN` (new file)|1301|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ModN`
`+ basis`
`+ basis_apply_eq_mkQ`
`+ instFinite`
`+ instModuleFinite`
`+ instance : Module (ZMod n) (ModN G n) := QuotientAddGroup.zmodModule (by simp)`
`+ liftEquiv`
`+ liftEquiv'`
`+ mkQ`
`+ natCard_eq`
`+ toZModLinearMapEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thank you Oliver for the thorough review! One less file in PFR soon.

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13544062509/job/37851441469)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13544062509/job/37851441070)

Thanks for sticking with this.

Please apply my final suggestions (keeping the `abbrev` if you are unconvinced) but applying the other changes, and then feel free to merge.

bors d+

Thanks for sticking with this.

Please apply my final suggestions (keeping the `abbrev` if you are unconvinced) but applying the other changes, and then feel free to merge.

bors d+
Can you squeeze these?
Not the first one. Then `simp [hc, NeZero.ne]` three lines below fails
In that case I think you need to capture it using `suffices`: currently it is a non-terminal simp and thus fails to conform to our guidlines.
Yeah actually that's more readable like that
Also here
What do you think about making this a `def` and adding the universal property for this type of quotient instead?
I don't really see the point since there is no semantic difference between `ModN G n` and `G ⧸ LinearMap.range (LinearMap.lsmul ℤ G n)`. I really want people to think of it as the quotient.

I contend that there's a good case for providing the universal property since it's quite a specialised quotient. Modulo golfing, here's what I propose:
```lean
variable (G n) in
protected def liftEquiv (M : Type*) [AddMonoid M] :
    (ModN G n →+ M) ≃ {φ : G →+ M // ∀ g, n • φ g = 0} where
  toFun f := ⟨f.comp (QuotientAddGroup.mk' _), fun g ↦ by
    let Gn : AddSubgroup G := (LinearMap.range (LinearMap.lsmul ℤ G n)).toAddSubgroup
    suffices n • g ∈ (QuotientAddGroup.mk' Gn).ker by
      simp only [AddMonoidHom.coe_comp, comp_apply, ← map_nsmul]
      change f (QuotientAddGroup.mk' Gn (n • g)) = 0 -- Can we avoid `change`?
      rw [this, map_zero]
    simp [QuotientAddGroup.ker_mk', Gn]⟩
  invFun φ := QuotientAddGroup.lift _ φ <| by rintro - ⟨g, rfl⟩; simpa using φ.property g
  left_inv f := by
    ext x
    induction x using QuotientAddGroup.induction_on
    rfl -- Should `simp` suffice here?
  right_inv φ := by aesop
```
Bearing in mind that it would be convenient for users also to have a universal property for `ModN G n →ₗ[ZMod n] M` I think we could upgrade `AddMonoidHom.toZModLinearMap` to:
```lean
def AddMonoidHom.toZModLinearMapEquiv (n : ℕ) (M M₁ : Type*) [AddCommGroup M] [AddCommGroup M₁]
    [Module (ZMod n) M] [Module (ZMod n) M₁] :
    (M →+ M₁) ≃+ (M →ₗ[ZMod n] M₁) where
  toFun f := f.toZModLinearMap n
  invFun g :=
    { toFun := g
      map_zero' := by simp
      map_add' := by simp }
  left_inv f := rfl
  right_inv g := rfl
  map_add' f₁ f₂ := by ext; simp
```
and then here also add:
```lean
variable (G n) in
protected def liftEquiv' (M : Type*) [AddCommGroup M] [Module (ZMod n) M] :
    (ModN G n →ₗ[ZMod n] M) ≃ {φ : G →+ M // ∀ g, n • φ g = 0} :=
  (AddMonoidHom.toZModLinearMapEquiv n _ _).symm.toEquiv.trans (ModN.liftEquiv G n M)
```
I feel this is likely to be a much more useful API than just regarding it as a quotient by the range of a `ℤ`-linear map.
I have added your universal properties, but I remain unwilling to drop the `abbrev`. There doesn't seem to be much point sealing the fact that this is a quotient

Well the fact that it is a quotient is exactly the existence of this universal property.

In support of my position, I claim that using the universal property with the spellings provided, rather than the property for general quotients, will actually make things easier for downstream users. I admit that this means we have to develop a little more custom API here but we pay this cost once whereas there is a theoretically unbounded number of occasions when downstream users will benefit.

Notwithstanding this position, I am willing to compromise so if you remain unconvinced, then we can certainly keep this as an `abbrev`. For example I could argue your position by saying that more API is more maintenance.

Okay sorry, I don't mean "quotient" but `Quotient`. We currently don't have a general API for "quotients", only an API for `Quotient` (and sometimes an API for specialised uses of `Quotient`, like the "quotient" by a submodule, which I use here). See #16421 for a possible way out of this unfortunate situation.

The little use I am expecting for this definition makes me think that transferring instances across the `def` is not worth the maintenance cost. I therefore will keep `abbrev`.

I also did try to make it a `def`, and indeed I have to copy over quite a few instances before it builds again

Can we also add:
```suggestion

variable (n) in
/-- The quotient map `G → G / nG`. -/
def mkQ : G →+ ModN G n := (LinearMap.range (LinearMap.lsmul ℤ G n)).mkQ

```

I think we should generalise slightly to:
```suggestion
noncomputable def basis {ι : Type*} (b : Basis ι ℤ G) : Basis ι (ZMod n) (ModN G n) := by
```
(I tested locally and it is trivial to amend proof for this statement).

It would be nice to add:
```lean
lemma basis_apply_eq_mkQ_apply {ι : Type*} (b : Basis ι ℤ G) (i : ι) :
    basis b i = mkQ n (b i) := by
  sorry
```
but I do not insist.
Makes sense, yes! I've also added `basis_apply_eq_mkQ_apply`

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: if `G` is a rank `d` free `ℤ`-module, then `G/nG` is a finite group of cardinality `n ^ d`
